comments.body: PLEASE ADD THIS! I NEED MY ROLEPLAY TRAIN
I was just about to say the same thing but you beat me to it

Came to suggest this myself, or at least the chain connection part, but you beat me to it with an even better thought out version with the furnace idea. Honestly surprised this hasn't happened yet considering it was suggested so long ago now.
YEEEEAAA! it would be so cool. Imagen having a stronghold be half stone half deepslate
there is bedrock under y = 0

414962937772

I obviously was talking about 1.17 (edit: 1.18) which deepslate generates between y=0 and y=-64.
Any structure that spawns underground beneath y 0 that was previously made of stone should be made of deepslate.
This would really make speedrunning more interesting
This is exactly what I thought, it will be in my base :)

I love this idea, this really makes sense, like a problem like this like when strongholds generate on deepslate level and the stronghold doesn't blend well with the deepslates cause they are made of stone bricks.
So I wonder if there is going to be deepslate monster egg variants too. So we get the same danger. I think it would be cool to have a dark silverfish variant.
Maybe strongholds should also be made of tuff under y level 0.

Agreed, we need Ice Caves and Caverns, ice variant of dripstone and ice blocks that replaces stone until it reaches a certain level, mostly found on the surface and high and be replaced by stone once goes below the surface level, polar bears would be a good way to find them and they live in them, the same goes to other biomes like desert, mesa, jungle and so on, so yeah

a few suggestions:

- the only mobs to spawn there are strays (or maybe a new mob)
- powder snow will generate frequently
- stray spawners (like skeleton and zombie spawners but for strays) will spawn only in these caves and will be the only spawner you find in them
Maybe this is the time for the Iceologer
amazing idea but you forgot dripstone, tuff, basalt, diorite, andesite, granite, terracotta, and concrete
I  believe it would be a great idea because Marble counters would have verity + Quartz doesn't really do it justice
Great idea !!!

I really like this idea. It reminds me of the recipes to create andesite, granite, and diorite from cobblestone and quartz; those recipes are great because they provide an alternative, albeit expensive way to craft blocks that some players may not have easy access to, if their world was created before the Bountiful Update (1.8). This suggestion is quite similar in that regard.

One nice thing about using amethyst in the recipes is that it forces players to find at least one geode before they can craft the blocks. That way, the blocks are still somewhat exclusive to the geode, but once you find one, it's possible (albeit expensive) to get as many of those blocks as you want through farming the crystals that grow there.

I imagine that calcite and tuff will both end up being quite popular in some building styles, and having them be craftable with amethyst would give a big reason to keep returning to the geodes to farm crystals.
It's actually quite common for tuff to form with andesite in it, so maybe that would be a better fit geologically than regular stone.
Tuff is a volcanic rock. It's not made of amethyst.
calcite is not white amethyst, calcite is a carbonate mineral, amethyst is a quartz, silicon mineral. tuff is volcanic ash.
I think the calcite recipe should be quartz and diorite as the texture doesn't show any amethyst if that makes sense?
Personally, I would prefer a recipe for calcite involving nether quartz and diorite.

The recipe for Calcite should be block of coal and bone blocks, because of the carbon and calcium that the coal and bones have a lot. And calcite is basically calcium carbonate.

An alternative is to use nautilus shells instead (that have calcium carbonate in the form of Aragonite).

The way it is currently, you're punished for using Silk Touch for mining Deepslate, in that you have a block that has no use other than directly decorative. If you use non-ST pick in order to Cobbled Deepslate, you have a block that can be turned into A LOT of decorative blocks as well as tools and functional blocks, and thus is very useful.  Because of this, it makes the Cobbled Deepslate -> Deepslate smelting recipe near pointless.

It makes more logical sense to make it function like stone/cobblestone do. Where the default block without Silkt Touch is the one that can be made into it's cobbled stair/slab/wall variants or used to craft tools/furnaces/etc, but in order to get Smooth Deepslate (and thus Deepslate Bricks and Deepslate Tiles) you must first smelt it to Deepslate.

As already mentioned. this is definitely a messed up recipe and should be switched to the same as Stone/Cobblestone. I was so lost when I went to try and make Deepslet Bricks...

Please update this recipe...
Stone parity

is there any specific reasoning behind this? im sure it was a simple oversight i hope to see this in 1.18 its really annoying that i cant craft deepslate variants if i silk touch the deepslate doesnt really make any sense in my opinion...

If you read the changelog for 1.17 it says that it should be the same parity as its stone counterpart. Hopefully this will be addressed as it is quite punishing when using silk touch to then have to re-mine the deepslate to be able to craft anything useful

I would disagree. Once you have a fully kit gear, the only pickaxe you need to bring is a ST pickaxe when adventuring. The fortune pickaxe could be left in your ender chest. This system encourages bringing a ST pickaxe and a  non- ST pickaxe with you when mining.

This was not changed in 1.18 and still makes no sense. How do you make bricks and tiles from cobbles? In real life you would need intact slate for that, cobbled slate isn't worth anything. It should work exactly the same way stone works. First smelt the cobbled variant into the intact variant (or get it with silk touch), and then craft the bricks from that. I don't understand why they would make it the other way around.
I just smelted 22 stacks of deepstone cobble for a build, die in the nether and lose all my stuff and then came back to find out you don't actually use deepstone to make deepstone bricks.
Still no change in sight as of 1.20 ? Please devs, this makes no sense.
I agree with the copper usage and that we need more uses for these, but idk about amethyst bricks.
If copper can be crafted into pipes then I will be happy with it. Amethysts are already useful, but I think that maybe they could have a more practical use in enchanting.

Copper Pipes, Copper Nugget and green fire.

Amethyst bricks, chiseled amethyst and amethyst columns.
Amethyst needs to be used as a magical item maybe enchanting but itd be cool to have more magical stuff rather than potions and enchants.
383961756051 You think that Amethysts are already useful? Can you please tell me why you think that, because imo theyre anything but.

Amethysts are useful for tinted glass, which prevents light from passing a certain area. Not only is this great for decoration, but it could also prevent light from entering certain areas while you could see through it, which is great for spawner farms. Spyglasses are also useful in Bedrock edition where there's no Optifine zoom.

I definitely think making note blocks out of wood and Amethyst would be a great idea! Replacing the middle ingredient with amethyst and the bottom with redstone. Definitely strongly believe in changing up some of the existing crafting recipes, such as the fact that iron is the most used item in crafting recipes and copper is a great replacement in the redstone recipes as in real life it is a better conductor. Things like amethyst could replace glass in recipes like the beacon and end crystal. There are tons of recipes like this, and I want purpose for mining my copper and amethyst.

Another use for amethyst could be jewelled armour. It would help individualize player armour. Crafting it could be another use for the blacksmith table.

It would consisit of small gemstones in fixed places on any of the metal or diamond armours. Geodes could be expanded to have various colour types, such as red ruby, yellow topaz, etc. It would provide even more incentive to find rare geodes as a wearable status symbol.

I have more ideas:
- Make bronze and brass, which might have their own uses.
- Copper tools? - Since copper appears to be so common, maybe they could be between stone and iron. Perhaps, copper pickaxes will only be able to break the blocks that stone pickaxes can break, but are more durable.
- Copper wire - carries redstone signals over longer distances with no delay.

Bronze uses:

Bronze tools - Between stone and iron, if copper tools are not implemented, and between copper and iron if they are.
I don’t really like the use of pipes for conveyance because Minecraft already has hoppers and item elevators(droppers, water, etc.).
But copper pipes would reduce so much lag.
i am starting a cobblestone mine on a server i play on and i have more Copper than i have Cobblestone and i cant do diddly squat with it
Agreed, copper is so common, and like, there’s nothing to do with it

Copper is like an ore and looks exactly the same as iron ingots just more coppery so I think copper should be used for two purposes.
-Armour
-Tools
I like this idea but the crystals aren't in a block form so I'm not entirely sure about it.
Amethyst shards should be included in crafting end crystals.
Ghast tears aren't a block either, yet they are used for end crystals.
Full length snow/ice/sand caves down to Y:0 would provide unique underground experiences without needing new materials. Transition to Deepslate from these biomes.
This would add some neccessary challenge to the new mountains! Great!
Nice Idea
if you approach Yeti again, Yeti will get angry
The Yeti could look like a humanoid goat, with shaggy white fur and horns on it's head
yeah the yeti could be a new boss

You could also have hostility determined by day/night factors: if it's day, the yeti only attacks you if you repeatedly get close to it, whereas during the night it will attack you regardless.

It could also hunt and kill goats: kills 1-2 goats, depending upon if the first goat was a child, and then does not need to hunt until the next day or a reasonable amount of time passes.
This would be really good if it was only hostile. Maybe not too much purpose for killing it, but it would make traversing mountains safer.

It would be good if its cave connects with the rest so even if you don't go looking for it, you would find it if you mine in a mountain there would be a risk of running into it and you would have a place to descend to the caves since with the new generation it is very common to find less than emeralds at the top of the mountain would be well worth facing him
or to make it oxidise faster in rain
But not too fast, or you can't wax them :)

This is an awesome idea, I was about to post this mysell until I noticed this. This would add so much more flexability to the Spyglass and I'd also see myself probably using it more if there was an adjustable zoom feature.
I want this so much, also the fact that the zoom is so powerful makes that players with shorter render distance can't use it properly. I hope this improvement will be applied at some point.
Thank you for adding variations for mobile and controllers
Not to mention this would make the process of taking pretty screenshots while using the F1 key much more inviting! Using the spyglass as a camera is so much fun!

I'm all for this idea. For one, it would be great for custom camera items in mapmaking. I think it would also be nice if the spyglass could remember its zoom level (perhaps as NBT) and displayed it somewhere in the item lore.

I really love this idea and I think it would be super useful to have in Minecraft but it would be very difficult to use on mac because the trackpad can't easily scroll and hold right-click at the same time, maybe a way to avoid this problem for mac users could be to use key binds (default: + to zoom in and - to zoom out) for Java, that way users will be able to change what the key binds are and if people who have a mouse want the scroll to zoom function, there could be a setting to toggle between using the scroll wheel and using the key binds.

They never said they would delete them. Henrik Kniberg just said that the way caves in general connect to and blend with the surface was not fully decided. I'm almost sure they would just improve them if anything.
It's been confirmed they would stay! sad the end revamp got removed tho.

1. Desert caves and Badlands caves. We have sandstone and red sandstone. Why not add desert caves and Badlands caves based on them? Maybe just for the sake of beauty. Maybe they can contain some special structures, such as tombs or altars. In the crevice of sandstone, some explorers or Rangers may have treasures here. Scorpions and snakes can also be Spawn here.

 

  1. Ice caves. In the dark, ice and snow are shining, ice cones are falling from above, and Stray shoots arrows. Under the thick ice, you can find some rare booty. But under the ice, there will also be the remains of some giant ancient creatures.

1. Spider caves. This cave is filled with cobwebs, where spiders and cave spiders frequently spawn, so it can be used as a good site for string factory construction. This kind of burrow may be a huge hindrance to the player's progress, but it will also become the symbol of a fortress: spider burrows are usually created around fortresses.

 

  1. Mushroom caves. This rare cave biome was covered with mushrooms, the floor was covered with Mycelium, and some shroomlight was spawned. New glow mushrooms and poisonous mushrooms are spawned here. There will also be swarms of fireflies in mushroom caves. Note: crimson fungus, warped fungus and nether wart will also be spawned in a small amount here, making mushroom cave the only source of nether wart except nether fortress.

1. Mineral cave. This extremely rare Mini cave is made entirely of various minerals! This is a miner's paradise!

 

  1. Desolate caves. The cave is made up of cobblestone and mossy cobblestone. Grass grows sparsely on the stone. Usually half naked on the ground. For decoration only.

 

  1. Dust cave. There is no grass in the cave. The ground is composed of one block deep water and coarse dirt, which makes it very difficult to move forward. It's a dead variant of the lush cave. Only undead creatures will be generated.
These are cool ideas but you should repost these suggestions individually so that it’s easier for people to find these ideas.
Yes this is just the cave update needs because the announced one are cool but these are just perfect

I only think the first two you said have a place in the game, and one of them is already posted on this site. String is too easy to get and doesnt have enough uses, nether stuff doesn't have a place in the overworld, the mineral cave is way too overpowered and would likely look ugly, and the last two have no uses whatsoever and would just seem like a placeholder to have new cave biomes.
it would be cool if at bedrock there would be small hints of the nether like small patches of netherack

I think, since minecraft a lot of fantasy, why we doesnt add at least one of fantasy cave like mushroom cave which there are a lot of glowing mushroom with mycelium for the ground, also i think the ice cave idea is not bad too with ice type of stalactites and stalagmites

Luminescent caves 

frost caves

magma caves

mushroom caves

toxic caves

spider nest caves

desert caves 

bamboo lush cave variant 

mega dripstone chasm 

underground woods 

Crystal caves with a blue purple green and red variant.
Good idea!
I would love to see this. Bathing in hot spring water could make your natural regeneration faster and cost less hunger.

New Biom?
Hot Spring is good.
Maybe after a minute or so, it could slightly burn you ever so often like magma blocks.
I would love hot springs to come to minecraft because there could be an enormous amount of things to do with it.
I think this would be interesting, as long as Microsoft lets Mojang fix the water system, so that it is not infinite, and then it would work
Zombies should turn to husks, and skelletons to strays.

Strays are now a result of a skeleton freezing.

But for the glow squid idea, I think this is hilarious and should be in the game.
This would definitely add some additional interest to the Glow Squid and could lead to some interesting farm ideas.
Yeah!
I think it would really hinder the beauty of the glow squid if you can’t safely transport it into captivity. It would be great to put them in underwater caves.

Great idea.

 

Or maybe also a Bucket of Small Slime?
Um... have you seen the size of those things? I don't think they'd fit in a bucket...
I agree, it doesn't make sense that all other fish are transportable but these mobs you can't even move on your own. it makes it very hard to add to your builds in survival.

In their defense... Squids and Glow Squids are kinda huge in comparison to a bucket. Although, given how octopi and squids in real life can fit inside ridiculously small spaces I could see them pulling it off.

Seeing glow squid with a tracing glow in the 1.18 caves. I thought it may be a bit easier to code in a glow squid in a bucket type design that can be off hand held as a tracing source of light!

Because while I know there are mods for it. I think a vanilla way of leaving caves unlit but still being able to see as you go would be really cool. And have it keep with Mojangs creative way of doing things!

That... and seeing as adorable as a tadpole in a bucket is. I want to see squid tentacles sticking out of one too!
Anything that's bioluminescent is perfect for caves.
Good idea!
Yeah, biomes designed for flooded caves would be great to have, it would add more diversity and would be an amazing thing to come across.

The new Minecraft Dungeons DLC gave me these ideas:
1st) Deeper oceans (up to the negative layers)
2nd) sea caves (preferably in the negative layers)
3rd) ravines in the sea
4th) Tropical Slime be added to MC Base
5th) New structures in the Oceans

To add on to this, I think it would make sense if this was only under ocean biomes, in the watery caves. I'd hope it wouldn't give off any light, it would just glow like the glow squid. Probably the same teal-ish color of the glow squid, too!
Would be really neat for atmosphere
this is an awesome idea, but i think they should add this with a food update.
Left clicking on 'Organic blocks' like grass/moss could give them a new dead variant, like coral and dead coral.
Loved the idea I saw it on reddit and got here threw the link good idea

It seems to me that salt should be included as mineral in caves and on the seabed. It could serve to increase the nutrition of some foods that look good with salt in real life. When the ore block was broken, an item would come out of a whitish crystal that would become fine crystals on the crafting table, already suitable for consumption.

To increase the food of salted food even more you should be able to dry them into a jerky. on a item frame exposed to the sun. it is needed to be exposed to the sun and dry slower in a swamp biome or jungle biome. it dries faster in desert & savannah biomes.Drying in a normal biome is 10 days. Desert & savannah 5 days, Swamp & jungle is 20 days. if you put lava under the item stand it reduces the time by 4 days

Jerky heals 8 food bars

You can even get salt from water in the ocean biome with a fishing rod in a dispenser

Instead of "Left clicking on 'Organic blocks' like grass/moss could give them a new dead variant, like coral and dead coral."

I think salt should stop the crop from growing, but not kill it. This would mean that a permanent green wheat could exist, or permanent 1/3 stage coco beans ect.

Builders often cap vines with string to stop it from growing, this is a cleaner solution.

Giving builders in survival and creative more options, while making the 2 gamemodes closer in ability. You would give you the ability to still have random tick speed at normal (keeping redstone, farms, and more working) but still have permanent non-growing crops.
Hooray for more blocks!
Halite is a stone in real life as well. In real life, it is a type of salt. I also think that another stone type, bauxite, should be added. In real life, bauxite is a type of laterite clay.

Halite can be found in a new cave biome maybe called Halite Hollow because there are salt mines in real life. It can be used to make salt which can then be used to preserve food. Food should be able to go bad after a certain amount of Minecraft days and putting salt on it would preserve it like they used to do it back then.
I thought it would look weird... Until I made the texture. I loved it!
Maybe not a pinkish tone, but a new wood type would help make the update feel a bit more full without the world gen in 1.17
I wish, the azalea wood type get all the variants of wood, we know from the other wood types (doors, steps, stairs, fences, fencegates and so on).

It would be great if they pulled in some purple from the amethyst and greys from the diorite or other less usable blocks. The bark and wood should be different colors to help pull together building palettes.
From what I've found online, Azalea wood appears to have more of a peach or cream color. Maybe more orange-ish if it's stained/varnished.
I’m not fond of the idea of another pink wood; I’d much rather have a wood color that matches that of chests or the backs of paintings
Nice idea. Would love this, because I normally don't come across rabbits.
Maybe only in tanner's chests and outposts? The others don't really fit.
Yes, I think they should be found in all those places. I think that they could also be obtained by trading with a farmer, shepard or fisher for the price of one emerald.
Love it!

Very nice idea!
Although I reckon it should also be found in shipwreck chests.

i think theyd fit nice in desert temples

maybe even with some sand and bones left in them
Maybe some loot could be inside bundles?

Right, hoes is perfect.
And more hoes functions.
Also make vines and huge mushroom blocks mineable with hoes instead of axes.
noce
That would be really cool
I have an idea what about you make copper slabs be able to cook on it with an item frame because it is a good conductor of heat and put any fire source under the slab or the copper block

Wouldn't another player just be able to make a new key for your chest? Seems like each chest should have only one key as well.

Or maybe it should be able to store which keys you can make under your player data, just like inventory, although this would limit servers to 2^32 locked chests, or prevent friends from making new keys for shared resources.
I love the security of locking my chest. I vote for this
this would be a great idea, also what if they add chest theifs that could steal from your chests, you could make a key to lock your chest
That is a great idea

This is a wonderful idea! Maybe the locked chest crafting recipe could use copper instead. After all, more uses for copper. There could be locked doors too, that would be pretty useful when map-making.

For this, I think we shouldn't use the normal chests but a new item entirely. The "new chest" recipe should have lodestone, and the keys a compass. Like a two in one item (similar to Flint and Steel), the "new chest" could be named "vault".

 

However, for the actual chests, it could be better to just make the copper key as a way to prevent/allow copper golem from using it. For example, the golem have a key to use these locked chests, with one key able to link up to 10 chests or so.

Thia would be perfect for the caves and cliffs update, updating a very old mob that actually is endemic to caves would make sense and would give that uniqueness the bat is lacking compared to all other mobs in the game, also it would be really cool if the player had a way to not be spotted by bats allowing him to avoid disturbing them and cause trouble which would make sense with the design principle of the game
Yes. I like this because it would give bats some sort of purpose.

I suggested something just like this. I was thinking that bat colonies could fly outside of caves at night if they are close enough to them. They would look for nectar from flowers and then they would fly back to their caves at sunrise so players could follow them to find a big cave.
The albino bat should be tameable
@DARKCHILD So like bees. When attacking they should cover the player, obscuring their vision.
